tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Schenker to Cube, dated January 14, 1932

tei:transcription.tei:p: {recto} [picture, captioned: Pitten – Niederösterreich] [Absender:] Schenker Wien, III Keilgasse 8
[An:] H. Prof [/] Felix von Cube Hamburg, Beneckestr. 2 bei Alex. Schmidt

Herzlichsten Dank für Ihren lieben aufklimmenden Brief! Since the most recent known letter from von Cube is OJ 9/34, [29], dated October 20, 1931, and Schenker has written to von Cube in the November/December, 1931 (vC 40), it seems likely that the letter referred to here is not known to survive. Darf ich Sie bitten, mir sozusagen umgehend die Frankfurter Notiz In Schenker's scrapbook (OC 2), a short newspaper article by Ludwig Rottenberg, headed “Für das klingende Meisterwerk!” and probably written in response to the publication of vol. 3 of Das Meisterwerk in der Musik, has been pasted onto p. 85. It is identified, in Cube’s hand, as from the “Frankf. Ztg.19.12.31” (Frankfurter Zeitung, December, 19, 1931) and must therefore be the article to which Schenker is referring to here. — Ludwig Rottenberg (1864–1932) was a pupil of the musicologist Eusebius Mandyczewski, and also Hindemith’s father-in-law. Schenker was in contact with him in the late 1920s. See Federhofer, Heinrich Schenker, nach Tagebüchern und Briefen (Hildesheim: Georg Olms, 1985), p. 153. zu schicken, von dir mir schon mehrere Personen hier Erwähnung getan haben? Besten Dank im Voraus u. mit herzlichsten Grüßen von mir u. meiner Frau[.]
Grüßen Sie das Haus Violin| Click on Moriz Violin. aufs Beste!

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Schenker to Cube, dated January 14, 1932

tei:translation.tei:p: [To:] Prof. Felix von Cube, Hamburg, Beneckestraße 2 c/o Alex. Schmidt

Most cordial thanks for your dear and encouraging letter. Might I ask you to send me at your earliest convenience the notice from the Frankfurter Zeitung, about which several persons have already mentioned to me. Best greetings in advance, and with most cordial greetings from me and my wife,
Send my best greetings to the Violin family!
